properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) a label to assign to the CloudIP

properties.name: reverse_dns
properties.description: (Optional) The reverse DNS entry for the CloudIP

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Optional) The CloudIP mapping target. This is the interface id from a server, or the id of a load balancer, server group or cloud sql resource.

properties.name: port_translator
properties.description: (Optional) An array of port translator blocks. The Port Translator block is descibed below
Note that the default group for each account cannot be used as the target for a cloud ip.

Port Translator (port_translator) supports the following: * incoming - (Required) The Port number traffic is coming in on the network * outgoing - (Required) The Port number traffic is received at the mapped device * protocol - (Required) The protocol of the port translator. Either tcp or udp
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) A label assigned to the Orbit container

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: (Optional) A dictionary of metadata key/value items. The key must be in lower case with no underscores or spaces

properties.name: container_read
properties.description: (Optional) A set of accounts and referrals that are allowed to read the Orbit container

properties.name: container_write
properties.description: (Optional) A set of accounts and referrals that are allowed to write to the Orbit container

properties.name: container_sync_key
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the secret key for Orbit container synchronization. If this is cleared synchronisation stops

properties.name: container_sync_to
properties.description: (Optional) Sets the destination for Orbit container synchronization. Used with container_sync_key

properties.name: versions_location
properties.description: (Optional) The Orbit container to hold previous versions of this Orbit container's contents, which are automatically restored if an item is deleted. Cannot be used at the same time as history_location

properties.name: history_location
properties.description: (Optional) The Orbit container to hold previous versions of this Orbit container's contents, where delete copies the item to history from this container. Cannot be used at the same time as versions_location
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: allow_access
properties.description: (Required) - A list of server group ids, server ids or IPv4 address references the database server should be accessible from. There must be at least one entry in the list

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) A label assigned to the Database Server

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A further description of the Database Server

properties.name: maintenance_weekday
properties.description: (Optional) Numerical index of weekday (0 is Sunday, 1 is Monday...) to set when automatic updates may be performed. Default is 0 (Sunday).

properties.name: maintenance_hour
properties.description: (Optional) Number representing 24hr time start of maintenance window hour for x:00-x:59 (0-23). Default is 6

properties.name: snapshots_schedule
properties.description: (Optional) A crontab pattern to determine approximately when scheduled snapshots will run (must be at least hourly)

properties.name: database_engine
properties.description: (Optional) Database engine to request. Default is mysql.

properties.name: database_version
properties.description: (Optional) Database version to request. Default is 8.0.

properties.name: database_type
properties.description: (Optional) ID of the Database Type required.

properties.name: snapshot
properties.description: (Optional) - Database snapshot id to build from

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) The handle of the zone required (gb1-a, gb1-b)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: server_group
properties.description: (Optional) The ID of the Server Group the policy will be applied to

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) A label to assign to the Firewall Policy

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A further description of the Firewall Policy
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: firewall_policy
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the firewall policy this rule belongs to

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: (Optional) Protocol Number or one of tcp, udp, icmp

properties.name: source
properties.description: (Optional) Subnet, ServerGroup or ServerID. any,10.1.1.23/32 or srv-4ktk4

properties.name: source_port
properties.description: (Optional) single port, multiple ports or range separated by - or :; upto 255 characters. Example

properties.name: destination
properties.description: (Optional) Subnet, ServerGroup or ServerID. any,10.1.1.23/32 or srv-4ktk4

properties.name: destination_port
properties.description: (Optional) single port, multiple ports or range separated by - or :; upto 255 characters. Example

properties.name: icmp_type_name
properties.description: (Optional) ICMP type name. echo-request, echo-reply. Only allowed if protocol is icmp.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A further description of the Firewall Rule
NOTE: Only one of source or destination can be specified
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) A label assigned to the Load Balancer

properties.name: policy
properties.description: (Optional) Method of load balancing to use, either least-connections or round-robin

properties.name: certificate_pem
properties.description: (Optional) A X509 SSL certificate in PEM format. Must be included along with certificate_key. If intermediate certificates are required they should be concatenated after the main certificate

properties.name: certificate_private_key
properties.description: (Optional) The RSA private key used to sign the certificate in PEM format. Must be included along with certificate_pem

properties.name: sslv3
properties.description: (Optional) Allow SSL v3 to be used. Default is false

properties.name: buffer_size
properties.description: (Optional) Buffer size in bytes

properties.name: nodes
properties.description: (Optional) An array of Server IDs

properties.name: listener
properties.description: (Required) An array of listener blocks. The Listener block is described below

properties.name: healthcheck
properties.description: (Required) A healthcheck block. The Healthcheck block is described below

Listener (listener) supports the following: * protocol - (Required) Protocol of the listener. One of tcp, http, https, http+ws, https+wss * in - (Required) Port to listen on * out - (Required) Port to pass through to * timeout - (Optional) Timeout of connection in milliseconds. Default is 50000

Health Check (healthcheck) supports the following: * type - (Required) Type of health check required: tcp or http * port - (Required) Port to connect to to check health * request - (Optional) Path used for HTTP check * interval - (Optional) Frequency of checks in milliseconds * timeout - (Optional) Timeout of health check in milliseconds * threshold_up - (Optional) Number of checks that must pass before connection is considered healthy * threshold_down - (Optional) Number of checks that must fail before connection is considered unhealthy
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: image
properties.description: (Required) The Server image ID

properties.name: server_groups
properties.description: (Required) - An array of server group ids the server should be added to. At least one server group must be specified.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The Server name

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) The handle of the server type required (1gb.ssd, etc)

properties.name: zone
properties.description: (Optional) The handle of the zone required (gb1-a, gb1-b)

properties.name: user_data
properties.description: (Optional) - A string of the desired User Data for the Server.

properties.name: user_data_base64
properties.description: (Optional) - Already encrypted User Data - for use with the template provider.
NOTE: Only one of user_data or user_data_base64 can be specified
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) A label assigned to the Server Group

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A further description of the Server Group
